The description of a brahmin who is prof: Well born on both his mother’s and father’s side
Irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation
Has mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth
Well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man
The three knowledges in the training of: The first knowledge attained by a mendicant is the recollection of past lives
The second knowledge attained by a mendicant is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings
The third knowledge attained by a mendicant is the knowledge of the ending of defilements
The qualities of a master of the three k: Whose mind is mastered, unified, serene
Who knows their past lives, and sees heaven and places of loss, and has attained the end of rebirth
